{{knowledge objective

|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the treatment of benign acute pericarditis
|Description=Rest, analgesics, anti-inflammatory bi-therapy: aspirin or ibuprofen and colchicine
|Rubric=Management
|Contributors=Jennifer Cautela
|Order=12}}


* Rest, no sport (minimum duration until resolution of symptoms after normalisation of CRP, ECG and ETT: in practice 3 months)'''
* Double anti-inflammatory treatment:''''
** '''AINS :''''
*** especially '''aspirin''' 1000 mg * 3 per day
*** or ibuprofen 800 mg *3 per day for 2 weeks
*** then decrease progressively according to symptoms and CRP
** Systematically combined with '''COLCHICIN:''''
*** 0.5 mg × 2 if weight > 70kg
*** 0.5 mg daily if weight <70kg
*** for 3 months,
*** calms pain and above all reduces the risk of recurrence
*** potential drug interactions (via cytochrome P450)
*** strict biological monitoring (transaminases, creatinine, CPK, CBC, platelets)
*** contraindicated in cases of severe renal impairment

* Association with gastric protection
* No corticosteroids as first-line treatment
* Most often ''favourable'' outcome

question.title: What is the recommended treatment for benign acute pericarditis?
question.description: The treatment of benign acute pericarditis

option_a.title: Rest and corticosteroids
option_a.description: Rest and corticosteroids are the recommended treatment

option_b.title: Rest, anti-inflammatory bi-therapy, and exercise
option_b.description: Rest, anti-inflammatory bi-therapy, and regular exercise are the recommended treatment

option_c.title: Double anti-inflammatory treatment with aspirin and ibuprofen
option_c.description: Double anti-inflammatory treatment with aspirin and ibuprofen are the recommended treatment

option_d.title: Rest, analgesics, and anti-inflammatory bi-therapy with colchicine
option_d.description: Rest, analgesics, and anti-inflammatory bi-therapy with colchicine are the recommended treatment

correct_option.title: d
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the option
